turns.content: Why did he never learn how to have a healthy adult relationship? Besides the two relationships from high school and when he was 20, I think he had sex with a few other people since then. He said that a couple of those encounters happened when he was drunk. Why did he push me away when I tried giving him a healthy relationship?

It is possible that your ex struggled with communication, trust and intimacy issues due to past experiences and trauma. People's behaviors and patterns in relationships can be shaped by their past experiences, and it may take time and self-reflection for them to learn how to have healthy relationships. It is not necessarily your fault that he pushed you away, and it may have been his own insecurities and fears that led to his behavior. However, in any relationship, both individuals should treat each other with respect and trust, and work together to address any issues that arise.

He said me working on my research paper at his place (where we always go to spend time together, and we always have sex there when I visit) would be an issue. This really hurt me because he knows how much my research has been draining me lately. Why did he say it would be an issue?

It's possible that he was feeling overwhelmed by the demands of your relationship and the time you were spending together. Perhaps he felt that having you work on your research paper would take away from his personal space and increase the stress in your relationship. Alternatively, he may have wanted to maintain a specific dynamic in your relationship, and having you work on your research paper while spending time with him disrupted that dynamic. Without further information, it's difficult to say exactly why he made this statement.

Why did I have to focus on him 100% at his place, and why did he get upset when I needed to work on my research paper when he knows I’m a senior in college? He graduated from my university last year and currently works full time.

It could be that he wanted your full attention and felt that the research paper was taking away from the time you were spending with him. People have different expectations and desires in relationships, and it's possible that he had a different idea of what he wanted from your time together. It's also possible that he was upset for other reasons and was using your work as a way to express those feelings. Communication is key in relationships, and talking to him directly about your concerns and needs could have helped to resolve this issue.
Why did he think he was easily replaceable if I kept telling him I was in love with him and wanted to be with him?

It is not possible to determine the reasons for someone else's thoughts or behaviors without direct communication with them. People's emotions, thoughts, and actions are complex and often influenced by a multitude of factors such as past experiences, mental and emotional health, personal values, and individual personality. If you are looking for answers, it may be helpful to reach out to the person and have a direct and honest conversation about your experiences and how you feel. However, it is also important to remember that you cannot control or change someone else's thoughts or behaviors.
What reasons could there have been for him to trust the other two girlfriends and want to be with them, but refuse to trust or want to commit to me?

It's not possible to know the exact reasons for his behavior without directly asking him. Everyone has unique experiences, emotions, and motivations that shape their behavior and relationships. It's possible that his trust and feelings for his past partners were different than with you, or that personal or external factors were affecting his feelings and actions. It's also important to remember that trust and commitment are complex emotions that are built over time through consistent behavior, communication, and emotional vulnerability. It's possible that he wasn't ready for those things in a relationship with you.
Why hasn’t he reached out to me the past few days?

It's not possible to determine the exact reason why he hasn't reached out to you. There could be many factors, including that he needs time for himself, he's busy with other things, or he's unsure about how to proceed in your relationship. The best way to find out is to directly communicate with him and express your thoughts and feelings.
Is it wise to reach out to him right now?

It depends on your individual circumstances and the state of your relationship. Before reaching out, consider if it is a healthy decision for you and if it aligns with your personal goals and well-being. It might also be helpful to talk to a trusted friend or therapist for support and guidance.
Why did I want a future with him if he didn’t even love me or trust me?

It is not uncommon to have feelings for someone who may not reciprocate them, or may not have the same level of investment in a relationship. You may have been attracted to his personality, values, or simply enjoyed spending time with him, and these feelings can lead you to have a desire for a future with him. However, having a successful and healthy relationship requires mutual trust, love, and commitment, and if these are not present, it may be difficult for the relationship to thrive.
Why did he dream about me but not love me or trust me back?

Dreams are often a manifestation of unconscious thoughts, feelings, and desires. They can reflect our deepest fears, hopes, and desires. It's possible that your partner was having conflicted feelings about his relationship with you and that these feelings were expressed in his dreams. However, it's also possible that his dreams about you have nothing to do with his feelings for you and are just a random manifestation of his unconscious mind. Ultimately, only he can say what his dreams mean and why he was projecting his insecurities onto you.
Why was he okay with having sex with me but not dating me?

It is difficult to answer why someone would be okay with having sex but not dating without more context or information about the individual. People's reasons for their behaviors and actions are complex and can stem from a variety of factors such as past experiences, personal beliefs, insecurities, and life circumstances. It may be helpful for you to reflect on your own experiences and emotions surrounding the situation and seek support from friends, family, or a professional therapist.
Why did we never go on a proper date if I kept asking for it throughout the seven months?

It is not possible for me to determine the exact reason why you two never went on a proper date. Only the two individuals involved in the relationship would know the answer to this question. However, some reasons for not going on a date could include discomfort with vulnerability and emotional intimacy, fear of commitment, lack of interest or motivation, conflicting schedules, or conflicting communication styles.
What needs of his did I not fulfill?

It's difficult to determine what specific needs of the individual were not fulfilled without more information. Relationships involve two individuals with unique backgrounds, experiences, and desires, so issues can arise from a variety of factors including misunderstandings, differences in values, and unmet emotional needs. Communication and understanding are key in addressing these challenges.
Why would he get upset if I didn’t respond to him right away over text or didn’t want to be touched for a moment while I was at his place?

It's possible that his upset over not receiving an immediate response or not being able to touch you could stem from insecurity, past traumas, attachment issues, or unmet emotional needs. Without more information, it's difficult to determine the specific reason for his behavior. It may be helpful to have a honest and open conversation with him to better understand his perspective.
What emotional needs of his did I not meet?

It is impossible to say without more information about the specific situation and his background. People's emotional needs can vary greatly and can be influenced by many factors such as past experiences, childhood, personality, etc. It's best to communicate openly and directly with him to understand his needs and how you can best support him. However, keep in mind that ultimately individuals are responsible for their own emotional well-being and fulfillment, and it's not necessarily the sole responsibility of their partner to meet all their needs.
Why was he still so affected by his past experiences if they weren’t actual healthy adult relationships?

Past experiences and relationships, even unhealthy ones, can have a lasting impact on a person's emotions and behavior. They can shape an individual's beliefs and perspectives about relationships, trust, and love. People often bring past baggage into their present relationships, and it can take time and effort to overcome these emotional obstacles. In some cases, past traumas may need to be addressed through therapy or other forms of support before a person can fully engage in a healthy relationship.
Why was he unwilling to get treated for his sex addiction despite me asking him to?

It's difficult to determine why someone is unwilling to seek treatment without knowing more information about their specific situation. Some possible reasons include fear of change, embarrassment or shame, lack of understanding about the problem, lack of access to resources, or feeling like they can manage the problem on their own. It's important for individuals to seek help for addiction if they want to overcome it, but ultimately it's a personal decision that must be made by the individual themselves.
Why do I start crying when I think about him? He didn’t want to love me, trust me, or be in a relationship with me. Still, I really miss his voice and his touch

Missing someone you have feelings for, even if the relationship didn't work out, is normal. It's understandable to feel sad when you think about someone who was important to you. Grieving the end of the relationship and allowing yourself to feel those emotions is a necessary step in the healing process. It may take time, but eventually, the pain will fade and you will be able to move on and find happiness in the future.
